title: Why electric planes could be the future of flight
text:
When Emma Kemp, a charity worker, decided to go on holiday to Italy and Croatia this year, she chose to do so by coach, train and ferry.

"I felt I was really travelling," despite the arduous journey, she said. "And I felt at peace with myself, having done something for the planet."

Kemp is just one of thousands of Britons who has been inspired by 16-year-old climate activist Greta Thunberg to shun air travel in a bid to mitigate climate change.

But could there be a better solution to avoiding planes altogether?

Nasa seems to think so. Today, the US space agency announced that it is preparing to fly its first crewed all-electric X-plane - a milestone that could speed up the development of electric...
description: When Emma Kemp, a charity worker, decided to go on holiday to Italy and Croatia this year, she chose to do so by coach, train and ferry.
